Package propra.controller

Class Controller

java.lang.Object
propra.controller.Controller
public class Controller extends Object
The Controller class serves as the main control unit for the application, handling the interaction between the model and the view components. It manages the Petrinet and graph visualizations, user interactions, and returns the panels of the graphs to the GUI for display. The GUI in returns sends commands to open and manipulate Petrinets and their reachability graphs.

  • Method Details

    • setFrame

      Sets the main application frame.
      Parameters:
      frame - The main application frame.

    • setClickListener

      clpg - ClickListener for the Petrinet visualisation.

    • setClickListener

      public void setClickListener(ClickListenerReachabilityGraph clrg)
      Sets ClickListener for the Reachability Graph visualisation.
      Parameters:
      clrg - ClickListener for the Reachability Graph visualisation.

    • initPanelGraph

      public void initPanelGraph()
      Initializes the panels of the visualizations for the Petrinet and the Reachability graph. The GUI is then able to access these.

    • displayGraphs

      public void displayGraphs(File pnmlFile) throws NoSuchElementException
      Loads a file and handles the visualisation of both the Petrinet and Reachbility graph for the GUI.
      Parameters:
      pnmlFile - The file that stores the Petrinet to be loaded
      Throws:
      NoSuchElementException - If an error occurs during file parsing.

    • disposeGraphs

      public void disposeGraphs()
      Resets the visualisation.

    • saveState

      public void saveState()
      Saves the current state of the Petrinet. This method captures the current marking of the Petrinet and pushes it onto the undo stack for future reference.

    • undo

      public void undo()
      Performs an undo operation. This method restores the Petrinet to its most recently saved state. If the undo stack is empty, it displays a warning message.

    • redo

      public void redo()
      Performs a redo operation. This method restores the state of the Petrinet to the state prior to the last undo operation. If the redo stack is empty, it displays a warning message.

    • isPlace

      public Boolean isPlace(String id)
      Checks if a given ID corresponds to a place in the Petrinet.
      Parameters:
      id - The ID to check.
      Returns:
      Boolean indicating whether the ID corresponds to a place.

    • isTransition

      public Boolean isTransition(String id)
      Checks if a given ID corresponds to a transition in the Petrinet.
      Parameters:
      id - The ID to check.
      Returns:
      Boolean indicating whether the ID corresponds to a transition.

    • fire

      public void fire(String id)
      Fires a transition in the Petrinet. If the transition is ready, it updates the marking of the Petrinet and reflects these changes in the reachability graph and visualizations.
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the transition to be fired.

    • manageToken

      public void manageToken(Boolean add)
      Manages tokens for a highlighted place in the Petrinet. If a place is selected, this method adds or removes a token based on which Button is selected in the GUI and updates the Petrinet state and its visual representation.
      Parameters:
      add - Boolean indicating whether to add (true) or remove (false) a token.

    • analyzeFile

      public String[] analyzeFile(File pnmlFile) throws NoSuchElementException
      Analyzes the Petrinet in the given PNML file to determine its properties.
      Parameters:
      pnmlFile - The PNML file to be analyzed.
      Returns:
      An array containing information about the Petrinet properties. Index 0: Filename Index 1: "Yes" if bounded, "No" otherwise Index 2: The count of nodes in the reachability graph or an empty string if unbounded Index 3: M' value if unbounded or an empty string if bounded Index 4: M value if unbounded or an empty string if bounded
      Throws:
      NoSuchElementException - If there is an issue with the file or during analysis.

    • toggleHighlight

      public void toggleHighlight(String id)
      Toggles highlighting of a specific node in the Petrinet graph.
      Parameters:
      id - The identifier of the node to toggle highlighting for.

    • resetToInitial

      public void resetToInitial()
      Resets the Petrinet to its initial marking.

    • resetReachability

      public void resetReachability()
      Resets the reachability graph to its initial state.

    • setMarking

      public void setMarking(LinkedList<Integer> marking)
      Sets the marking of the Petrinet to the provided marking.
      Parameters:
      marking - The marking to set for the Petrinet.
